items.text: To the Lord concerning the thoughts of sadness that lead the intellect to an abyss filled with dead persons and that imprint in the heart obscene visions—this is an indication of a soul that has fallen into danger
items.verse: Why do those who sadden me prevail against me? My wound is severe: from where will I receive healing? It has indeed become for me like deceitful water, which has no trustworthiness.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the demons that say to us in our intellect, “Soon you will be put to shame in your way of life”
items.verse: Let those who persecute me be put to shame, but do not let me be put to shame. Let them be alarmed, but do not let me be alarmed. Bring upon them the evil day; crush them with double destruction.

items.text: Against the soul that is frightened by the attacks of demons that happen through touching
items.verse: Do not be afraid of them, nor be alarmed before them, because it is a house of provocateurs.

items.text: Against the soul that is not convinced that the demons do not have authority even over swine, even though they boast, “We have authority over human beings, and we enslave them according to our will”
items.verse: Now a large herd of swine was feeding at some distance from them. The demons begged him, “If you cast us out, send us into the herd of swine.” And he said to them, “Go!.”

items.text: Against the soul that does not understand that weakness of faith brings trepidation and fear into the heart
items.verse: Do not let your hearts be troubled. Have faith in God, have faith also in me.

items.text: Against the soul that is sad because it has suffered dishonor for the sake of the Lord’s name
items.verse: As they left the council, they rejoiced that they were considered worthy to suffer dishonor for the sake of the name.

items.text: Concerning the suffering that comes from temptations
items.verse: And not only that, but we also boast in our sufferings, knowing that suffering produces endurance, and endurance produces character, and character produces hope, and hope does not disappoint us, because God’s love has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit that has been given to us.

items.text: Against the thought that prophesies to me severe sufferings that come from temptations
items.verse: I consider that the sufferings of the present time are not worth comparing with the glory about to be revealed to us.

items.text: Against the soul’s thought that supposes that it is tested beyond its strength
items.verse: God is faithful, and he will not let you be tested beyond your strength, but with the testing he will also provide the way out so that you may be able to endure it.

items.text: Against the soul, concerning a stupefying, indescribable temptation, which I do not want to reveal in words because of those people who, whether out of malice or out of ignorance, ridicule with both careful and careless words and who suppose that demons do not harass monks openly—these are persons who have no experience at all of the warfare of those demons that, through a request made of God, have received the authority to test us
items.verse: Indeed, we felt that we had received the sentence of death so that we would rely not on ourselves but on God who raises the dead. He who rescued us from so deadly a peril will continue to rescue us.

items.text: Against the demon that brings to me the sins of my youth
items.verse: Everything old has passed away; see, everything has become new.

items.text: Against the thoughts of sadness that come to us concerning transitory affairs, sinking the intellect into great affliction and killing it
items.verse: For godly grief produces a repentance that leads to salvation and brings no regret, but worldly grief produces death.

items.text: Against the thoughts of the soul that is joined in open warfare against the demons
items.verse: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

items.text: Against the thoughts that expect the soul to be wounded by demons and the body to fall into incurable illness
items.verse: Now who will harm you if you are eager to do what is good? But even if you do suffer for doing what is right, you are blessed. Do not fear what they fear, and do not be intimidated, but in your hearts sanctify Christ as Lord. Blessed is our Lord God and Savior Jesus Christ, who has given us the victory over the demon of sadness!

title:
FIFTH BOOK
Against the Demon of Anger

items.text: Against the soul that does not know that a gift readily extinguishes a brother’s long-standing grudge
items.verse: Jacob said, “If I have found favor before you, receive the gifts from my hands. For this reason I have seen your face, as someone might see the face of God, and you will be pleased with me. Receive my blessings that I have brought to you, because God has been merciful to me and is everything to me.”

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that arise along the way of righteous living
items.verse: Do not get angry along the way.

items.text: Against the thought of bearing false witness that is born of anger
items.verse: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

items.text: Against the thought that came from a slanderer and that arouses and stirs up rage against the brothers
items.verse: You shall not accept an idle rumor.

items.text: Against the thought that is stirred up by anger and wants to revile the brothers
items.verse: You shall abstain from every unjust word.

items.text: Against the thought that depicted in the intellect a brother who in hatred said something wicked or listened to something hateful—this is like what John the prophet, the seer of Thebes, used to report, “It is possible for this hatred not to continue if it has to do with wealth or food, but hatred on account of the glory that comes from human beings is difficult to uproot”
items.verse: You shall not hate your brother in your thinking. But with a reproof rebuke your neighbor, and you will not take on sin because of him.

items.text: Against the soul that thinks that perfect humility is beyond [human] nature
items.verse: And the human being Moses was very meek, beyond all the human beings that were upon the earth.

items.text: Against the soul that does not understand that revilings from human beings occur when God hands it over to be tested
items.verse: David said to Abishai and to all his slaves, “Look, my son who came forth from my bowels seeks my soul, and also now the son of Benjamin. Let him revile, because the Lord has spoken to him. If somehow the Lord looks upon my lowliness, he will return to me good things instead of his reproaches on the last day.”

items.text: Against the soul that has neglects humility but longs to learn the ways of the Lord
items.verse: He will guide the meek in judgment; he will teach the meek his ways.

items.text: Against the soul that accepts thoughts of anger and collects against the brothers wicked pretexts and false suspicions
items.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; do not be anxious, so that you do evil. For the evildoers shall be destroyed, but those who wait for the Lord, they shall inherit the earth.

items.text: Against the thought that is set in motion by slander of the brothers and that obscures the soul with a cloud of rage
items.verse: Sitting, you slander your brother, and against your mother’s son you have placed a stumbling block.

items.text: To the Lord because the intellect realized that frightening visions in the night come from the tumult of rage, and it understood as well that they are extinguished through mercy and patience
items.verse: You have made me wise in your commandment beyond my enemies, for it is mine forever. I have understood more than all my teachers, for your testimonies are my meditation.

items.text: Against the demon that provokes anger against the brothers and also persuades us to chant this psalm, where is written the command to be patient, which we do not keep—it [the demon] does this in order to mock us as we speak that commandment which we do not keep in action
items.verse: How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a foreign land?

items.text: Against the thought that collects wicked ideas against a brother, for example, that he is negligent or he is a reviler or he does not do what he ought
items.verse: Do not devise evil things against your friend, who lives near you and trusts in you.

items.text: Against the thought that came from hatred and wanted to quarrel with a brother about transitory affairs
items.verse: Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all who do not love strife.

items.text: Against the thought that compelled us to pronounce a curse against a brother
items.verse: Righteous lips cover enmity, but those who pronounce curses are extremely foolish.

items.text: Against the anger that is agitated against a brother and at the time of prayer makes the intellect unseemly
items.verse: Every blessed soul is sincere, but an angry man is unseemly.

items.text: Against the thought that arouses our anger against cattle that do not go straight on their path
items.verse: A righteous person pities the souls of his cattle, but the feelings of the ungodly are unmerciful.

items.text: Against the thought that is quickly aroused by anger and, based on a trivial pretext, agitates the intellect
items.verse: A fool immediately announces his anger, but a clever man conceals his disgrace.

items.text: Against the thought that thinks up treachery against a brother
items.verse: A treacherous person will not catch game, but a pure man is a precious possession.

items.text: Against the soul that marches on the way of resentment and, by means of thoughts, drags the intellect along, so that the intellect becomes enflamed with anger, and even after the thought of this passion subsides and some time has passed, there remains a representation of a word or transitory matter that clouds and imprints the intellect
items.verse: In the ways of righteousness is life, but the ways of those who carry resentments lead to death.

items.text: Against the thought of anger that disturbs and uproots patience and makes us consider acts of folly, the power of which comes from the desire for possessions and instead of which humility ought to be aroused
items.verse: The patient man abounds in understanding, but the impatient one is very foolish.

items.text: Against the thought of anger that prevents us from answering with humility those who chastise us rightly
items.verse: Anger destroys even wise persons; a submissive answer turns away anger, but a painful word raises up anger.

items.text: Against the thought that provokes us to strife with the brothers and prevents us from cutting off arguments
items.verse: An irascible man prepares arguments, but a patient one soothes an argument that is just starting.

items.text: Against the soul that supposes that it is not the thought of anger that is an abomination before God, but only the sin that results from it
items.verse: An unrighteous thought is an abomination to the Lord, but words of the pure ones are holy.

items.text: Against the thought that advised us to love angry people and words of wrath
items.verse: Do not be a companion to an irascible man, and do not lodge with an angry friend, lest you learn his ways and receive snares for your soul.

items.text: Against the soul that has suffered wrong and wants to do wrong as well—this is an indication of an evil passion belonging to a soul that loves vain things
items.verse: Do not say, “As he has treated me, I will treat him, and I will repay him the wrong he has done me.”

items.text: Against the intellect that is not merciful, does not have pity on its enemy when it sees him in bitter poverty, and does not want to dissolve his enmity with a meal
items.verse: If your enemy is hungry, feed him, and if he is thirsty, give him drink. For by doing this you will heap hot coals upon his head, and the Lord will reward you with good things.

items.text: Against the soul’s thought that is quickly enflamed with anger and is swiftly embittered against the brothers
items.verse: Do not be quick in your spirit to become angry, for anger rests in the breast of the foolish.

items.text: Against the soul that does not want to let go of pretexts for anger, but desires food, clothing, riches, and the glory that passes away; anger that is stirred up on account of these things does not depart from the heart, but rather plunges the intellect into the depths of perdition
items.verse: Remove anger from your heart, and take evil from your flesh, for youth and folly are vanity.

items.text: Against the demon that seeks through many temptations to extinguish our love for the brothers
items.verse: Much water will not be able to extinguish love, and rivers will not drown it.

items.text: Against the thought that provokes me to write to the person who has caused us trouble harmful words that will strike his heart
items.verse: Woe to those who write evil, for it is by writing that they write evil.

items.text: To the Lord concerning thoughts of anger that no longer provoke us
items.verse: You have judged, Lord, the causes of my soul; you have redeemed my life. You saw my troubles; you have judged my case. You have seen all their vindictiveness; [you have seen] into all their thoughts against me.

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that our parents and siblings present to us at the time when they persecute us on account of the Lord’s name
items.verse: Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

items.text: Against the thought that is agitated against a brother due to listlessness
items.verse: If you are angry with a brother, you will be liable to judgment.

items.text: Against the intellect that has become angry with someone who struck it and, because of a second strike, does not want to let go of the thought that came because of the original strike
items.verse: If anyone strikes you on the right cheek, turn the other also.

items.text: Against the thoughts that provoke us to hate and curse our enemies
items.verse: Love your enemies, and pray for those who persecute you, so that you may be children of your Father in heaven.

items.text: Against the thought of anger that is not satisfied with a brother’s repentance but rather becomes newly embittered against him
items.verse: If your brother sins, you must rebuke him, and if he repents, you must forgive him. And if he sins against you seven times a day, and turns back to you seven times and says, “I repent,” you must forgive.

items.text: Against the intellect that accepts thoughts of anger against the brothers and perverts the commandment of love, which is called “new”
items.verse: I give you a new commandment, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also should love one another.

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that are embittered against love
items.verse: Who will separate us from the love of Christ? Will hardship, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

items.text: Against the thoughts of envy that rejoice in the misfortune of our enemies
items.verse: Rejoice with those who rejoice; weep with those who weep. Live in harmony with one another.

items.text: Against the thought that holds a grudge and endeavors to repay evil to the one who grieved it
items.verse: Do not repay anyone evil for evil, but take thought for what is noble in the sight of all.

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that advise us to take advantage and to defraud
items.verse: Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded? But you yourselves wrong and defraud—and brothers at that.

items.text: Against the thought of anger that becomes enraged against someone who taunted us about [our] slavery
items.verse: Were you a slave when called? Do not be concerned about it. If you can become free, avail yourself of the opportunity. For whoever was called in the Lord as a slave is a freed person belonging to the Lord.

items.text: Against the soul that is not permitted the frank speech of love but is deprived of it by a thought of anger
items.verse: If I speak in the tongues of mortals and of angels, but do not have love, I am a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal. And if I have prophetic powers, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. If I give away all my possessions, and if I hand over my body so that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing. Love is patient; love is kind; love is not envious or boastful or arrogant or rude. It does not insist on its own way; it is not irritable or resentful; it does not rejoice in any wrongdoing, but rejoices in the truth. It bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. Love never ends.

items.text: Against the soul that is swiftly angry but wants to find within itself the frontier of the knowledge of truth
items.verse: The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, generosity, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.

items.text: Against the thoughts that cast us into grief over the brothers’ failings
items.verse: Bear one another’s burdens, and in this way you fulfill the law of Christ.

items.text: Against the soul’s thoughts that feed on anger against someone who received many good things from us and then complained about them
items.verse: So let us not grow weary in doing what is right, for we will reap at harvest time, if we do not give up.

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that do not permit us to be reconciled to the brothers because they depict before our eyes pretexts that are “suitable” yet actually are shame, fear, and pride—“Did he not fall into the very same offenses as earlier, he who transgressed in this matter?”—this is an indication of the craftiness of the demon, which does not want to let the intellect become free of resentment
items.verse: Do not let the sun go down on your anger, and do not make room for the devil.

items.text: Against the thoughts of any kind that are born of anger about matters of different sorts
items.verse: Put away from you all bitterness and wrath and anger and wrangling and slander, together with all malice.

items.text: Against the thoughts of anger that dare to murmur about service to the brothers
items.verse: Do all things without murmuring and arguing, so that you may be blameless and innocent, children of God without blemish, in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation.

items.text: Against the thoughts that derive from enflamed anger and that, from their heat, give birth to blasphemy and treachery
items.verse: But now you must get rid of all such things—anger, wrath, malice, slander, and abusive language from your mouth. Do not lie to one another.

items.text: Against the thoughts that want to repay evil for evil
items.verse: See that none of you repays evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to all.

items.text: Against the soul that does not know the aim of God’s commandment and, because of thoughts of anger, perverts it
items.verse: The aim of such instruction is love that comes from a pure heart, a good conscience, and sincere faith.

items.text: Against the intellect that by means of thoughts stirs up conflict in its thinking
items.verse: The Lord’s slave must not be quarrelsome, but kindly to everyone.

items.text: Against the thought of anger that happens to me because of persecution, when I am persecuted by my parents and my relatives because of the Lord’s name
items.verse: All who want to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.

items.text: Against the thought that provokes anger in us over a brother who accepted money or something else that he needed and is not working to repay it
items.verse: If he has wronged you in any way, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

items.text: Against the soul that gets angry swiftly but seeks the righteousness of God
items.verse: Let everyone be quick to listen, slow to speak, slow to anger; for your anger does not produce God’s righteousness.

items.text: Against the thought that has filled the intellect with anger but wants to see its soul in God’s wisdom
items.verse: But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, willing to yield, full of mercy and good fruits, without a trace of partiality or hypocrisy. And a harvest of righteousness is sown in peace for those who make peace.

items.text: Against the thought that is moved by slander of the brothers and scorns the lawgiver—“He did not act justly when he established this law that he commanded, saying, ‘Do not slander your brother’ ”
items.verse: Do not speak evil against one another, brothers. Whoever speaks evil against another or judges another, speaks evil against the law and judges the law; but if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge. There is one lawgiver and judge who is able to save and to destroy.

items.text: Against the intellect that wants to repay evil for evil or abuse for abuse and does not want, through blessings, to forget abusive and slanderous thoughts
items.verse: Do not repay evil for evil or abuse for abuse; but, on the contrary, repay with a blessing. It is for this that you were called—so that you might inherit a blessing.

items.text: Against the intellect that has said that the fear of God is in it but hates its brother
items.verse: Whoever says, “I am in the light,” while hating a brother, is still in darkness.

items.text: Against the thoughts that are born of hatred and make the intellect murderous toward a brother
items.verse: All who hate a brother are murderers, and you know that murderers do not have eternal life dwelling in them.

items.text: Against the intellect that professes to love God but, thanks to hatred toward a brother, has renounced the earlier love
items.verse: Those who say, “I love God,” and hate their brothers, are liars; for those who do not love a brother whom they have seen, cannot love God whom they have not seen. Blessed is our Lord Jesus Christ, our God, who has given us the victory over the thoughts of the demon of anger, so that we might defeat it! 133

title:
SIXTH BOOK
Against the Thoughts of the
Demon of Listlessness

items.text: Against the thought of the demon of listlessness that hates the manual labor of the skill that it knows, and wants to learn another skill by which it will be better supported and which will not be so arduous
items.verse: By the sweat of your face you shall eat bread, until you return to the earth from which you were taken. For you are earth, and to earth you shall return.

items.text: Against the thought that because of listlessness is moved to slander the abbot on the pretext, “He does not comfort the brothers, but he is harsh with them and does not show them mercy in their afflictions”
items.verse: You shall not revile the gods nor speak evilly of the rulers of your people.

items.text: Against the soul that succumbs to the thought of listlessness and impatiently expects to be filled with the fruits of the knowledge of truth
items.verse: You shall persevere and take the fruits of the land.

items.text: Against the intellect that because of thoughts of listlessness has inclined itself again to the world and loves it [the world] and the affairs that arise from it
items.verse: Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one. And you shall love the Lord your God with all your mind and with all your soul and with all your strength.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that deprives us of reading and instruction in spiritual words, leading us astray as it says, “Look, such-and-such holy old man knew only twelve Psalms, and he pleased God”
items.verse: And let these words, all that I have commanded you today, be in your heart and in your soul. And you shall teach them to your sons, and you shall speak of them sitting in your house, walking on the road, lying down, and rising up.

items.text: Against the soul that receives thoughts of listlessness whenever a little ailment comes upon the body
items.verse: And the Lord will remove from you all sickness, and he will not lay upon you any of the evil diseases of Egypt that you have seen and known, but he will lay them upon those who hate you.

items.text: Against the thought that because of listlessness wants its family and the people of its household and thinks, “The demon of listlessness is stronger than we are, and I cannot defeat the thoughts that come forth from it and oppose me”
items.verse: The Lord your God will hand over your enemies who oppose you utterly broken before you; they will come forth against you on one road, and on seven roads they will flee from before you.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that shuns the reading of and meditation on spiritual words and which advises us to ask the Lord that we might learn the Scriptures through his Spirit
items.verse: And the book of this law shall not depart from your mouth, and you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may know how to do all the things that are written, and you will prosper... Look, I have commanded you.

items.text: Against the soul that at the time of listlessness considers and says, “Why does the Lord so permit me to be tested by the demons? Sometimes they stir up our anger against the brothers who are near us, but at other times they cast us into sadness by compelling us to be annoyed with the brothers who are far from us as well”—these are the tricks of the thoughts of listlessness
items.verse: And the Lord became very angry with Israel and said, “Inasmuch as this nation has abandoned my covenant, which I commanded their fathers, and has not listened to my voice, for my part I will no longer cast out from before them a man from the nations that Joshua the son of Nun left in the land.” And he left Israel to be tested by them, [to see] whether they would keep the way of the Lord, to walk in it, as their fathers kept it, or not. So the Lord left these nations so as not to cast them out quickly, and he did not deliver them into the hand of Joshua. And these are the nations that the Lord left to test Israel by them, all who had not known the wars of Canaan, but on account of the generations of sons of Israel, to teach them warfare, only those who had not before known them.

items.text: Against the hardened soul that does not want to shed tears at night because of thoughts of listlessness—for the shedding of tears is a great remedy for nocturnal visions that are born from listlessness, and David the prophet wisely applied this remedy to his passions when he said
items.verse: I am wearied with my groaning; I will wash my bed every night; with tears I will water my couch.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thoughts of listlessness that persist in me
items.verse: Look upon my affliction and my trouble, and forgive all my sins.

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that take away my hope
items.verse: I believe that I will see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living.

items.text: Against the thought of murmuring that derives from listlessness and that dares to be silent concerning praise
items.verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; his praise will be continually in my mouth.

items.text: Against the soul that in listlessness receives thoughts that take away its hope by showing it how very difficult the monastic life is and that a human being can scarcely endure its way of life
items.verse: Hope in the Lord, and do kindness; dwell in the land, and you will be fed with its wealth.

items.text: Against the miserable soul that is listless and chooses other places in which to live
items.verse: Wait on the Lord, and keep his way, and he will raise you up to inherit the land.

items.text: Against the intellect that does not know that, when thoughts of listlessness persist in it, they trouble its stability, and at the time of prayer they obscure the holy light in its eyes— concerning this light, I and God’s servant Ammonius wanted to know where it comes from, and we asked the holy John, the seer of Thebes, whether it is the nature of the intellect to be luminous and thus it pours forth the light from itself or whether it [the light] appears from something else outside and illumines it [the intellect]; but he answered us and said, “No human being is able to explain this, and indeed, apart from the grace of God the intellect cannot be illumined in prayer by being set free from the many cruel enemies that are endeavoring to destroy it”
items.verse: My heart is troubled; my strength has left me; and the light of my eyes is not with me.

items.text: Against the soul that wants to learn whether the soul truly is handed over to temptations from demons whenever it is briefly abandoned by the holy angels
items.verse: My friends and neighbors drew near before me and stood, and my nearest of kin stood far off, while those who seek my soul pressed hard upon me, and those who seek evil things for me spoke empty things and plotted deceits the entire day.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that takes away the hope of our endurance on the pretext that one cannot through its duration persuade the Lord to have mercy on us
items.verse: I waited patiently for the Lord, and he attended to me and listened to my supplication.

items.text: Against the soul that supposes that tears are of no benefit at the time of combat with listlessness and that does not remember that David did this very thing, saying to God
items.verse: My tears have been my bread day and night.

items.text: Against the soul that succumbs to listlessness and becomes filled with thoughts of sadness
items.verse: Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you trouble me? Hope in God, for I will give thanks to him, the salvation of my countenance and my God.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the demon of listlessness that contends with me all day
items.verse: Have mercy upon me, Lord, for humanity has tread upon me and afflicted me by making war all day.

items.text: To the Lord because thoughts of anger and desire have departed from me
items.verse: We went through fire and water, and you brought us out into rest.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thoughts of listlessness that are in us, “So-and-so, one of our brothers or one of our relatives, has attained and joined a rank of honor and authority, and he has become a powerful man”
items.verse: It is good for me to cleave to God, to place my hope in the Lord.

items.text: Against the thought that entices us at the time of listlessness to journey to the brothers on the pretext of being comforted by them
items.verse: My soul refused to be comforted. I remembered God and rejoiced; I poured out my complaint, and my soul fainted.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that reckons for me a long time and years of a wretched life
items.verse: As for a human being, his days are like grass; as a flower of the field, so will he flourish.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that is eager to find another cell for its dwelling place on the pretext that the first one that it had was very foul and full of moisture so that it got all kinds of diseases from it
items.verse: Here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thoughts that persecute and terrify my intellect
items.verse: For the enemy has pursued my soul; he has brought my life down to the ground; he has made me dwell in dark places, like those who have been dead for ages. And my spirit was grieved in me; my heart was disturbed within me.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that rejects manual labor and leans the body in sleep against the wall
items.verse: How long will you lie down, sluggard? When will you wake from sleep? You sleep a little, and you lie down a little, and you nap for a while, and you fold your arms over your breast for a little. Then poverty comes upon you like an evil traveler, and need like a swift courier.

items.text: Against the thought that neglects the labors involved in the service of the commandments
items.verse: Blessed is the person who begins to help, who depends on hope.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that complains about the brothers on the pretext that there is no love in them and they do not want to console those who are sad and weary
items.verse: A man who wishes to separate from his friends looks for excuses, but at all times he is liable to reproach.

items.text: Against the soul that is saddened because of a thought of listlessness
items.verse: Do not reject the chastening of the Almighty, for he causes pain, and then he restores again; he smites, and his hands heal. Six times he will deliver you from distresses, and the seventh time evil will not touch you.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that depicts to us a prolonged old age, severe poverty without consolation, and diseases that can kill the body
items.verse: Ask the former generation, and search diligently among the race of the fathers; for we are of yesterday and do not understand, for our life upon the earth is a shadow.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that shows us other places and advises us to acquire a cell there on the pretext that there we will be able to meet our needs without toil and [to provide] peace and consolation to the brothers who come to us
items.verse: Is not the extent of my life short? Permit me to rest a little before I go where I will not return, to a dark and gloomy land, to a land of eternal darkness, where there is no light nor does anyone see the life of mortals.

items.text: Against the soul that in listlessness thinks that there is no one who sees its afflictions
items.verse: Do not say that a man has no visitation; indeed, he has a visitation from the Lord.

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that call blessed those who have dealings with the world
items.verse: For all the nations will walk each in its own way, but we will walk in the name of the Lord our God forever and beyond.

items.text: Against the soul that because of a disease of the body receives thoughts of listlessness
items.verse: I will bear the Lord’s anger because I have sinned against him, until he rectifies my cause. And he will perform my judgment and bring me out to the light, and I will see his righteousness.

items.text: Against the soul that has fallen under the weight of listlessness and cries out due to the sloth that results from thoughts of listlessness
items.verse: Look, all those who oppose you will be put to shame and confounded, for they will be as if they were not, and all your opponents will perish.

items.text: Against the soul that, due to the thoughts of sloth and listlessness that have persisted in it, has become weak, has been brought low, and has dissipated in the miseries of its soul; whose strength has been consumed by its great fatigue; whose hope has nearly been destroyed by this demon’s force; that has become mad and childish with passionate and doleful tears; and that has no relief from anywhere
items.verse: Thus says the Lord, “Let your voice cease from weeping and your eyes from tears, for there is a reward for your labors, and they will return from the land of your enemies, and your children [will have] an abiding home.”

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thoughts of listlessness that shake our endurance and provoke us to take a little break and make an extended visit to our home and kinfolk
items.verse: Lord, act on our behalf for your own sake, for our sins are numerous before you, for we have sinned against you. Lord, you are Israel’s endurance, and you save in the time of evils.

items.text: Against the thoughts that show us the monastic life, that there are many afflictions and great labors in its discipline
items.verse: The Lord is good to those who wait for him. The soul that seeks him is good: it will endure and quietly await the salvation of the Lord.

items.text: Against the thought that said that a person can acquire purity and stability apart from the monastic life
items.verse: It is good for a man when he bears a yoke in his youth, sits alone, and is silent, because has taken it upon himself. He will give his cheek to the one who strikes him, and he will be filled with reproaches. For the Lord will not reject forever.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thought of listlessness that has grown strong against me
items.verse: Do not hand us over to the end for the sake of your name, and do not disband your covenant, and do not remove your mercy from us for the sake of Abraham your beloved, and for the sake of Isaac your slave and Israel your son.

items.text: Against the thought of listlessness that advises us to visit our fleshly father
items.verse: Let the dead bury their own dead; but as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.

items.text: Against the soul that has succumbed to listlessness and wants to return to its fleshly relatives
items.verse: Everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields, for my name’s sake, will receive a hundredfold and will inherit eternal life.

items.text: Against the soul that is not convinced that Christ called love toward its family hatred, when he spoke in this way to souls that are in the passions of desires and that love the world
items.verse: Whoever comes to me and does not hate father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, and even life itself, cannot be my disciple.

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that are in us on the pretext, “Look, our relatives are saying about us that it is not on account of God that we have left the world and embraced monasticism, but on account of our sins or on account of our weakness, because we could not excel in the affairs of the world”
items.verse: We must obey God rather than human beings.

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that come upon us due to afflictions
items.verse: Be patient in suffering, persevere in prayer.

items.text: Against the thoughts that due to listlessness dare to murmur
items.verse: Do not complain as some of them did, and were destroyed by the destroyer.

items.text: Against the thought that is saddened because of thoughts of listlessness and that does not remember the Apostle’s trials, which he recounted, saying
items.verse: ... with far greater labors, far more imprisonments, with countless floggings, and often near death. Five times I have received from the Jews the forty lashes minus one. Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I received a stoning. Three times I was shipwrecked; for a night and a day I was adrift at sea; on frequent journeys, in danger from rivers, danger from bandits, danger from my own people, danger from Gentiles, danger in the city, danger in the wilderness, danger at sea, danger from false brothers; in toil and hardship, through many a sleepless night, hungry and thirsty, often without food, cold and naked. And besides other things....

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that do not give thanks for the fathers and brothers
items.verse: ... giving thanks to God the Father at all times and for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Be subject to one another out of reverence for Christ.

items.text: Against the soul that does not know that for a human being to suffer for Christ is a gift given by the Spirit
items.verse: For he has graciously granted you the privilege not only of believing in Christ, but of suffering for him as well—since you are having the same struggle....

items.text: Against the soul’s thoughts that have been set in motion by listlessness and want to abandon the holy path of the illustrious ones and its dwelling place
items.verse: For you need endurance, so that when you have done the will of God, you may receive what was promised. For yet “in a very little while the one who is coming will come and will not delay; but my righteous one will live by faith. My soul takes no pleasure in anyone who shrinks back.”

items.text: Against the thought that entices us to see the city, my family, and my loved ones there
items.verse: For here we have no lasting city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.

items.text: Against the soul that has succumbed to listlessness and sadness and in its heart reckons that it has been handed over to the punishment of the demons
items.verse: Others suffered mocking and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment. They were stoned to death, they were sawn in two, they were killed by the sword; they went about in skins of sheep and goats, destitute, persecuted, tormented—of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and mountains, and in caves and holes in the ground.

items.text: Against the thoughts of listlessness that are angry with the holy fathers on the pretext that they are unfeeling and do not want to console the brothers, and therefore these thoughts are fed up with them and do not want to submit to them
items.verse: Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they are keeping watch over your souls and will give an account. Let them do this with joy and not with sighing.

items.text: Against the thought of the soul that is saddened because of the spirit of listlessness that has persisted in it and altered its condition
items.verse: My brothers, whenever you face trials of any kind, consider it nothing but joy, because you know that the testing of your faith produces endurance; and let endurance have its full effect, so that you may be mature and complete, lacking in nothing.

items.text: Against the intellect that due to a thought of listlessness is thrown all over the place, at one time driven from places by anger, then at another time dragged by the throat to other places near the brothers, or to relatives in the world—a condition that has often humiliated and wearied it
items.verse: Blessed is anyone who endures temptation. Such a one has stood the test and will receive the crown of life that God has promised to those who love him. Blessed is our Lord Jesus Christ, who gives us the victory over the thoughts of the demon of listlessness! 147

title:
SEVENTH BOOK
Against the Thoughts from the
Demon of Vainglory

items.text: Against the thought from the demon of vainglory that advises us to go forth into the world at an improper time on the pretext that we might instruct the brothers and sisters and persuade them to [take up] the monastic life
items.verse: Save your own soul. Do not look back or remain in the entire surrounding area. Escape to the mountain, lest perhaps you be overtaken.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that stirs up in me jealousy toward the brothers who have received from the Lord the gift of knowledge
items.verse: Are you jealous of me? Would that all the Lord’s people were given to be prophets when the Lord gives his Spirit upon them.

items.text: Against the soul that has received unclean thoughts, desires the priesthood because of the vainglory that has seized it, and does not recognize the danger that follows it [the priesthood]
items.verse: And Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, took the bronze censers, which those who had been burnt brought near, and put them as a covering for the altar, as a reminder to the children of Israel that no foreigner may come near who is not from the seed of Aaron to offer incense before the Lord; and so he shall not be like Korah and those who conspired with him, just as the Lord said by the hand of Moses.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that performs righteousness on account of human beings
items.verse: You shall pursue righteousness justly, so that you may live and go in and inherit the land that the Lord your God gives you.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that is yoked with a saying about ascetic achievements and pulls the plough of vainglory
items.verse: You shall not plough with an ox and an ass together.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory, “Look, you are honored among all the brothers”
items.verse: I am a humble person and not honored.

items.text: Against the soul that because of vainglory does not want to leave a place that is not suitable for habitation
items.verse: And the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “Look, the place where we live before you is too constricted for us. Let us go to the Jordan, each man taking there one beam, and let us make for ourselves there a place to live.” And he said, “Go.”

items.text: Against the soul that, because of the vainglory that has seized it, supposes that the demons were speaking the truth when they promised it the priesthood
items.verse: For there is no truth in their mouth; their heart is vain; their throat is an open tomb; with their tongues they have deceived.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that incites us to teach the brothers and the worldly people when we have not yet acquired health of the soul
items.verse: For the sparrow has found itself a home and the turtledove a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, your altars, Lord of hosts.

items.text: Against the thoughts of vainglory that render the intellect useless with all kinds of thoughts, sometimes making it the steward of God’s wealth and sometimes appointing it overseer of the brothers
items.verse: Depart from me, evildoers, and I will investigate my God’s commandments.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that advises me sternly to withdraw from the brotherhood and to cloister myself from the brothers, supposing that they lead me astray
items.verse: The proud have hidden a snare for me.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that compelled us to talk a lot about superfluous things—this excess becomes quickly apparent in monks who live in seclusion but who, due to vainglory, throw themselves into the affairs of the world and gladly welcome people who come to them to settle disputes they have with one another
items.verse: By talking a lot you will not escape sin, but by using your lips sparingly you will be prudent.

items.text: Against the thought that advised us before we have reached stability to preside over the brothers and lead their souls in the knowledge of Christ
items.verse: There is a way that seems to people to be right, but its ends lead to the depths of Hades.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that entices us to give up the Scriptures from then on because we have not grasped their power
items.verse: Whoever answers a word before he has heard, it is a folly and a reproach to him.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that encourages those who are very young to settle by themselves
items.verse: Let the one who acts be restrained in his pursuits; let a youth be with a holy person, and his way will be straight.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that advised us to give surety for the worldly people who love us when the creditor was harassing them
items.verse: Do not give yourself as surety out of respect for reputation, for if they do not have the means to pay back, they will take the bed out from under you.

items.text: Against the soul that because of vainglory tells some of the secrets of the monastic life to worldly people
items.verse: Speak nothing into a fool’s ears, lest he ever sneer at your wise words.

items.text: Against the thoughts that entice us to go out in the world in order to benefit those who see us
items.verse: The words of crafty persons are gentle, but they strike into the depths of the bowels.

items.text: Against the demon that, concerning the great temptations that attack us openly, again persuades us to permit it [to attack]—this, as the holy prophet John told us, it does on account of vainglory; we should answer it as the blessed one answered it, saying
items.verse: A weeping enemy promises everything with his lips, but in his heart he contrives deceit. If the enemy begs you with a loud voice, do not be persuaded, for there are seven abominations is his soul.

items.text: Against the thoughts that compel us because of vainglory to make known our illustrious way of life
items.verse: Let your neighbor praise you, and not your own mouth, a stranger and not your own lips.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that compelled us to speak when we should not and advised us to be silent when we should speak
items.verse: A time to be silent and a time to speak.

items.text: Against the soul that is not convinced that Satan as well knows those who serve the Lord
items.verse: The devil answered and said before the Lord, “Does Job worship the Lord for nothing? Have you not made a hedge around him, around his household, and around all that is his? You have blessed the works of his hands, and you have made his cattle numerous upon the land.”

items.text: Against the demon that advised us, saying, “I will make you illustrious everywhere before all people,” and pretended that it would help us
items.verse: But the Lord of hosts will send dishonor upon your honor, and burning fire will be kindled against your glory.

items.text: Against the soul that loves glory from human beings more than the knowledge of Christ
items.verse: All flesh is grass, and all the glory of humanity is like the flower of grass. The grass withers, and the flower fades, but the word of our God endures forever.

items.text: To the Lord concerning thoughts of glory that persisted in us and that bring down an intellect that the demons of anger, sadness, and pride have already wounded
items.verse: Heal me, Lord, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved; for you are my boast.

items.text: Against the demon that, while I was asleep at night, made me the shepherd of a flock and, during the day, interpreted the dream for me, saying, “You will be a priest, and look, those who want you will soon come after you”
items.verse: They destroyed my life in a pit, and they laid a stone upon me.

items.text: Against the demon that attacked our intellect and said, “Look, soon you will be caught up to heaven” (cf. 2 Cor 12:2)—some of the brothers have thought this and have plunged into a fierce tempest and suffered shipwreck
items.verse: Well have you lied against your own head, for already God’s angel has received the sentence from God to cut you in two.

items.text: Against the demon that promised us in our heart that it would through wisdom make us famous among kings and rulers
items.verse: Well have you lied against your own head, for the angel of God waits, sword in hand, to cut you in two, in order to destroy you.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that, before doing the commandments of God, wants to teach them to the brothers
items.verse: Whoever does them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that completely attached itself to acts of piety and made the intellect perverse
items.verse: Beware of practicing your piety before others in order to be seen by them; for then you have no reward from your Father in heaven.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that appears to us in the condition of pure prayer and likens the intellect to the form that it wants, although the intellect is invisible and formless, and depicts it [the intellect] praying to the divine—this happens to the intellect that is troubled by the passion of vainglory and comes from the demon that at the time of prayer approaches its place on the pretext that it might show what is visible to many children and women—let the one who can understand, understand
items.verse: And whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites; for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may be seen by others. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward.

items.text: Against the thoughts of vainglory that endeavor through a sad appearance to reveal our fasting, as if the intellect had been set free and released from thoughts of gluttony, in order that the intellect may be bound and held captive by the thought of vainglory—the filthy demons plot to do this so that the intellect will not be able to stand and fix its gaze on God, transcending thoughts
items.verse: And whenever you fast, do not look dismal, like the hypocrites, for they disfigure their faces so as to show others that they are fasting. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward.

items.text: Against the thoughts of vainglory that compel the soul to speak in empty words, and that endeavor to entangle the intellect in transitory affairs, by which they set in motion in us either desire or anger, or that depict in the intellect obscene visions that spoil the condition of purity that adorns and crowns our prayer
items.verse: I tell you, on the day of judgment you will have to give an account for every careless word you utter; for by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.

items.text: Against the thoughts that come with the joy that the unclean spirits have fled from our souls
items.verse: Do not rejoice at this, that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.

items.text: Against the demon that said to me in my heart, “Look, you are proficient with the gift of healing that you have received”
items.verse: When he lies, he speaks according to his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.

items.text: Against the demon that advised us to acquire the priesthood through money
items.verse: May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain God’s gift with money!

items.text: Against the soul that is troubled by vainglory and desires to learn the wisdom of the Greeks
items.verse: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that wants to boast in the labor of the stable way of life
items.verse: Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord. For it is not the one who commends himself that is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that encourages us to persuade our relatives that if we live justly in the monastic life we will be worthy of the soul’s health and knowledge of the truth
items.verse: Am I now seeking human approval, or God’s approval? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still pleasing people, I would not be a slave of Christ.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that advises me to do something so that I might be honored with the priesthood
items.verse: And one does not presume to take this honor, but takes it only when called by God.

items.text: Against the thought of vainglory that encourages us to teach although we have not acquired the soul’s health or knowledge of the truth
items.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers, for you know that we who teach will be judged with greater strictness. For all of us make many mistakes. Anyone who makes no mistakes in speaking is perfect, able to keep the whole body in check with a bridle.

items.text: Against the thoughts of vainglory that request gifts of healing or knowledge of God
items.verse: You ask and do not receive, because you ask wrongly, in order to spend what you get on your pleasures.

items.text: Against the thoughts of vainglory that seek the world and depict its glory before our eyes
items.verse: Do not love the world or the things in the world. The love of the Father is not in those who love the world.

title:
EIGHTH BOOK
Against the Cursed Thoughts of Pride

items.text: Against the thought of pride that said to me, “I am the Lord’s holy one”
items.verse: You are cursed above all cattle and all the beasts upon the earth. You will go on your breast and on your belly, and you will eat dirt all the days of your life.

items.text: Against the thought of pride that glorifies me and exalts me on the pretext that I am pure and no longer receive filthy thoughts
items.verse: Now I have begun to speak to my Lord, but I am earth and ashes.

items.text: Against the blasphemous thought that denied that God feeds me and that rejects the angel that assists me
items.verse: God, who continues to feed me from my youth until this day; the angel, who rescues me from all evils.

items.text: Against the soul that wants to learn what the proud demons say when they see us investigating spiritual matters
items.verse: Let the tasks of these people be burdensome, and let them care about these things and not care about empty words.

items.text: Against the proud thought that rejected the salvation of God, by whose help we defeat the seven other demons, the companions of the demon of pride
items.verse: Let us sing to the Lord, for he is greatly glorified: horse and rider he has thrown into the sea. He was to me a helper and protector for salvation.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thought of pride that glorifies me on the pretext that by my great strength I have cast down the demons of sadness
items.verse: Your right hand, Lord, has been glorified in strength; your right hand, Lord, has broken the enemies. And in the abundance of your glory you have broken the adversaries to pieces.

items.text: Against the thoughts of pride that compel the soul to scorn the holy angels on the pretext that they cannot instruct it about the mistakes that it makes, so that it abandons them because it thinks these things and it succumbs again to the filthy demons, that is, the thoughts of pride
items.verse: Look, I am sending my angel before you, so that he may keep you on the way and lead you into the land that I have prepared for you. Pay attention to him and listen to him, and do not disobey him, for he will not give way to you, for my name is upon him.

items.text: Against the thought of pride that advised us to scorn our holy fathers on the pretext that they have not labored in their way of life any more than we have
items.verse: You shall rise before a venerable face, and you shall honor the face of an elder, and you shall fear your God.

items.text: Against the blasphemous thought that sends the intellect into utter ruin
items.verse: Whichever human being curses God shall bear his sin. Whoever names the name of the Lord, let him perish utterly; let the entire congregation of Israel stone him with stones.

items.text: To the Lord because blasphemous thoughts persist in us and destroy the frankness of prayer
items.verse: Arise, Lord, and let your enemies be scattered; let all that hate you flee.

items.text: Against the soul that does not know the beauty of knowledge and is convinced by the demon that has advised it to shun the knowledge of Christ and the holy commandments, which it [the demon] belittles before our eyes
items.verse: But from among those who spied out the land, Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh tore their garments and said to the entire congregation of the sons of Israel, “The land that we surveyed is very good. If the Lord chose us, he will lead us into this land and give it to us, a land flowing with milk and honey. Only do not depart from the Lord.”

items.text: Against the blasphemous thought that made us consider whether God is in us or not
items.verse: You shall not tempt the Lord your God.

items.text: Against the soul that proudly supposes that by its own strength it has conquered the demons that oppose our doing the commandments
items.verse: Do not say in your heart, “My strength and the might of my hand have made for me this great power.” But you shall remember the Lord your God, who gives you the strength.

items.text: Against the intellect that has supposed that because of its righteousness and justice it has defeated its enemies and has entered and inherited the knowledge of Christ
items.verse: When the Lord your God has destroyed these enemies from before you, do not say in your heart, “Because of my righteousness the Lord has brought me in to inherit this good land.” Not because of your righteousness and not because of your heart’s holiness do you go in to inherit their land; rather, because of the wickedness of these nations, the Lord will destroy them from before you.

items.text: Against the demon that said to me that all people bless me and that I am the progenitor of sages
items.verse: You are cursed in the city, and you are cursed in the field. Cursed are your barns and your storehouses. Cursed are the offspring of your belly and the fruits of your land.

items.text: Against the blasphemous thought that denied the free will that is in us and said that we sin and are justified not by our own will and therefore condemnation is not decreed justly
items.verse: Look, I have set before you this day life and death, good and evil.

items.text: Against the thoughts of the soul that is not aware that it should not suppose that every angel that suddenly appears to it belongs to the Lord, rather only if, when it speaks, it gives joy and perfect peace to the soul, after its appearance had brought trembling and fear—but the demons in their appearance do not impart this peace; rather, they cast great fear and trembling into the soul and body, and through their hollow voice they bring agitation and disorder upon the heart
items.verse: And it happened that when Joshua was in Jericho, he looked up and saw with his eyes a person standing in front of him with a drawn sword in his hand. And Joshua approached him and said, “Do you belong to us or our enemies?” And he said to him, “It is I, the general of the Lord’s hosts, who has now come.” And Joshua fell on his face on the earth and said to him, “Lord, what do you command your servant?.”

items.text: Against the thought of pride that denied God’s grace
items.verse: If a man should sin greatly against a man, still they will pray for him to the Lord. But if he sins against the Lord, who will pray for him?

items.text: Against the soul that wants and is pleased to kneel, and works to humiliate the blasphemous demon that stops our ceaseless prayers
items.verse: And Elijah went up to Carmel and stooped to the ground and put his face between his knees.

items.text: Against the soul that is shaken by the frightening thoughts of blasphemy and falls away from the frankness of prayer
items.verse: Do not be afraid of the words that you have heard, by which the Assyrian king’s slaves have blasphemed. Look, I am putting a spirit in him, and he will hear a report, and he will return to his own land, and I will overthrow him with the sword in his own land.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the words by which the demon spoke in us unspeakable blasphemies against the Lord, things that I cannot write, lest I shake heaven and earth; for in anger this demon stands without fear and speaks great blasphemy against God and the holy angels—those who have been tempted by it understand what I am saying—and at the time of this temptation what is excellent is fasting, reading of the Scriptures, and unceasing prayers offered with tears
items.verse: Lord God of Israel, who dwells over the cherubim, you are the only God in all the kingdoms of the earth; you made heaven and earth. Incline your ear, Lord, and hear; open your eyes, Lord, and see; and hear the words of Semmacherim, which he has sent to reproach the living God.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thought of pride that denied that the victory comes from God
items.verse: From you comes victory, and from you comes wisdom, and yours is the glory, and I am your servant. Blessed are you, who gave me wisdom, and I confess you, ruler of our fathers.

items.text: To the Lord concerning blasphemous thoughts that have persisted in me
items.verse: Lord my God, in you I have hoped: save me from all those who persecute me, and rescue me, lest he ever seize my soul like a lion, without anyone to ransom or to save.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the demon of pride that has approached us and that often appears like an angel of light (cf. 2 Cor 11:14), leading a great army of demons with it
items.verse: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of sinners shake me.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thought of pride that denied God’s help and attributed victory to its own strength
items.verse: For I will not hope in my bow, and my sword will not save me. For you saved us from those who afflict us, and you have put to shame those who hate us.

items.text: Against the demon that promises to interpret the Scriptures for us—we should say as our holy father Macarius said
items.verse: To the sinner God has said, “Why do you declare my ordinances and take my covenant with your mouth? You hated my instruction and cast my words behind you.”

items.text: Against the proud thoughts that surround the intellect and cast it into great ruin
items.verse: How long will you besiege a human being? You are all slaughtering by means of a bent wall and a broken fence.

items.text: To the Lord concerning proud thoughts that have persisted in us and have caused the intellect to lack frankness at the time of prayer
items.verse: The words of lawless persons have overpowered me, but as for you, pardon our sins.

items.text: Against the thoughts of blasphemy that said unspeakable things concerning the Lord
items.verse: Do not lift high your horn, and do not speak unrighteousness against God.

items.text: Against the thought of pride that glorifies me on the pretext that I edify souls with a stable way of life and knowledge of God
items.verse: Unless the Lord builds the house, the builders labor in vain; unless the Lord guards the city, the guards keep watch in vain.

items.text: Against the proud thought that derides the brothers on the pretext, “Look, they are neglecting the service of the commandments”
items.verse: The Lord opposes the proud, but gives grace to the humble.

items.text: Against the soul that wants to learn what the cruel demons’ food is
items.verse: For they live on the bread of impiety and get drunk on the wine of transgression.

items.text: Against the proud thought that has prevented me from seeing the brothers on the pretext that they are no better than I am in knowledge
items.verse: A person who travels with the wise will be wise, but the one who travels with fools will be recognized.

items.text: Against the proud thought that at a time of severe and prolonged temptation prevents me from entreating the Lord through the brothers
items.verse: A brother who is helped by a brother is like a strong and high city.

items.text: Against the proud thought that considered me pure and victorious
items.verse: Who will boast that he has a pure heart? Or who will boldly say that he is pure from sins?

items.text: Against the proud thought that called success fear
items.verse: Blessed is the man who cowers before all things because of piety, but the hard-hearted one will fall into evils.

items.text: Against the proud thoughts that are puffed up against the brothers because of our fleshly birth and suppose that it is glorious
items.verse: Everything goes to one place: everything came from the dust, and everything will return to the dust.

items.text: Against the proud thought that shows me the brothers’ sins
items.verse: For there is not a righteous person on earth who will do good and not sin.

items.text: Against the demon that said to me, “Look, you have become a perfect monk”
items.verse: There is hope because a living dog is better than a dead lion.

items.text: Against the demons that “heal” the mature person of humility [and bring him] to the pride of the sick
items.verse: But you are all unjust physicians and healers of diseases.

items.text: Against the thoughts that seize the intellect into blasphemy against God
items.verse: Do you not speak before the Lord and utter deceit before him?

items.text: Against the proud thought that recounted for me the brothers’ sins
items.verse: For who will be pure from uncleanness? Not even one, even if his life were one day upon the earth and he can count its months.

items.text: Against the soul that, due to the pride that has seized it, supposes that its way of life is like an acceptable offering before God
items.verse: For what does it concern the Lord if you were blameless in your works?

items.text: Against the thought of the demon that compelled the intellect to commit impiety in heaven
items.verse: The Lord rebuke you, devil, and the Lord rebuke you, he who has chosen Jerusalem.

items.text: Against the proud thought that exalts me as if I were a wise man
items.verse: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes and knowing in their own estimation.

items.text: Against the soul that is not convinced that nothing alarms the demons and casts them into fear except the knowledge of Christ, which unmasks all their strategies and uncovers the cruelty of their secret thoughts
items.verse: And the land of the Jews will serve as a terror to the Egyptians: whoever will name it to them they will fear because of the counsel that the Lord of hosts has desired concerning it.

items.text: Against the proud and blasphemous thoughts that make the demons gods
items.verse: So speak to them: “Let the gods that did not make heaven and earth perish from the earth and from under this heaven.”

items.text: To the Lord concerning the thought of pride that glorifies me and has said, “Look, you have been victorious over your enemies”
items.verse: I know, Lord, that the way of the human being is not his own: a man will not go and direct his own travel.

items.text: Against the soul that is saddened by a blasphemous thought
items.verse: For the Lord will not reject forever. For he that brought down will have pity, even according to the abundance of his mercy. He has not answered from his heart, and he has brought low the sons of a man.

items.text: To the Lord concerning the blasphemous thoughts that cover the intellect at the time of prayer
items.verse: You have visited in wrath and have driven us away. You have killed and have not shown pity. You have veiled yourself with a cloud because of prayer, so that I will be blind and cast off. You have placed us among the nations.

items.text: Against the proud demon that names itself God
items.verse: Will you actually say, “It is I who am God,” before those who kill you? But you are a human being and not God. You will perish at the hands of foreigners among the multitude of the uncircumcised, for I have spoken, says the Lord.

items.text: Against the soul that despises a brother on the pretext that he is negligent and not diligent and, because it is bound by the fetters of pride, does not recognize the magnitude of this sin
items.verse: Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log in your own eye?

items.text: Against the blasphemous demon that has spoken lies—the unclean foods are thoughts
items.verse: It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles.

items.text: Against the soul that is oppressed by thoughts of pride and does not know how to drive them out from it
items.verse: This kind can come out only through prayer and fasting.

items.text: For the proud intellect that desires to be first among the brothers
items.verse: Whoever wants to be first must be last of all and servant of all.

items.text: Against the proud thought that supposed that it need do nothing more than God’s commandments
items.verse: We are worthless slaves; we have only done what we ought to have done.

items.text: Against the proud thought that justifies itself and is not pleased by what is accomplished by the brothers in weakness
items.verse: For all who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.

items.text: Against the proud thought that despises a brother who does not eat and considers him to be weak on the pretext, “He is not able to stand in the battle when eating, and therefore he has given himself to fasting”
items.verse: Those who eat must not despise those who abstain.

items.text: Against the proud thought that passed judgment on the one who eats on the pretext, “It is because he cannot control himself ”
items.verse: And those who abstain must not pass judgment on those who eat.

items.text: Against the proud thought that glorifies me on the pretext, “I am able not only not to be enslaved to the belly, but also to conquer anger”
items.verse: It was not I, but the grace of God that is with me.

items.text: Against the soul that is not convinced that even Satan himself imitates an angel of truth and becomes a teacher of false knowledge
items.verse: Even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light. So it is not strange if his ministers also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness. Their end will match their deeds.

items.text: Against the proud thoughts that despise the brothers who stumble because of their faults
items.verse: My brothers, if anyone is detected in a transgression, you who have received the Spirit should restore him in a spirit of gentleness. Take care that you yourselves are not tempted.

items.text: Against the proud thought that exalts me on the pretext that I have attained perfection in the service of the commandments
items.verse: Not that I have already attained this or have already been made perfect; but I press on to make it my own, because Christ Jesus has made me his own.

items.text: Against the proud thought that exalts me on the pretext that there is no image of sin in my thinking
items.verse: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, he who is faithful and just will forgive our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

items.text: Against the soul’s thoughts that request from the Lord the soul’s health until the end
items.verse: Now to him who is able to keep you from falling, and to make you stand without blemish in the presence of his glory with rejoicing, to the only God our Savior, through Jesus Christ our Lord, be glory, majesty, power, and authority, before all time and now and forever. Amen.
